content.webTitle: Porton Down veterans sue MoD for millions

fields.headline: Porton Down veterans sue MoD for millions
fields.bodyText: Hundreds of ex-servicemen used as human guinea pigs in Ministry of Defence experiments at Porton Down from the 1940s to the1980s are to claim millions of pounds in compensation, their lawyers announced yesterday. Martyn Day, of the law firm Leigh, Day & Co, said that if the MoD did not come up with an out-of-court compensation scheme in two months, a no-win, no-fee group action on behalf of 350 veterans would be launched in the high court. The veterans say they were not told they were being subjected to chemical warfare agents at the MoD's chemical defence establishment.
